summary.intro: I am a Japanese-Chinese bilingual from Beijing. I'm conducting research that combines foreign language education and machine learning at Kyoto University Graduate School.
summary.business: In October 2023, I founded EastLinker Inc. and have been commissioned to develop a vocabulary profiler for the National Institute for Japanese Language and Linguistics.
summary.development: I am developing an English learning app called 'LANDS' using Swift and Node.js, and working on web development with React.
summary.research: My research includes automatic generation of multiple-choice vocabulary questions using Word2Vec and vocabulary difficulty measurement using LLMs, utilizing fine-tuning of LLM models, Gensim, Scikit-learn, and Transformers.
summary.focus: I focus on the educational applications of Large Language Models (LLMs) and have extensive experience in team development.

skills.title: Skills
skills.introduction: Introducing the tech stack that I regularly use
skills.highlight1Description: As a Japanese-Chinese bilingual, I leverage my experiences of living in different cultural and linguistic environments. This experience helps me communicate smoothly in international team environments and solve problems from diverse perspectives. Additionally, my experience as a Japanese language teacher at New Oriental (7 years, 5,000+ hours) forms the foundation for educational content development and effective knowledge transfer.
skills.highlight2Description: By combining my expertise as a researcher and technical skills as an engineer, I can provide unique value in the fusion of education and technology. My experience in developing automatic vocabulary question generation algorithms and building vocabulary difficulty estimation models directly translates to the design of efficient learning support tools. In a project for the National Institute for Japanese Language and Linguistics, I have experience in turning theoretical research into practical web applications.
skills.highlight3Description: My vision for the next 5 years is to develop proprietary LLMs specialized for language learning and build a comprehensive learning platform utilizing them. I aim to construct high-precision models using unique training datasets incorporating linguistic insights, provide personalized learning experiences, and implement adaptive learning systems tailored to learners' proficiency levels. Through these technologies, I also want to contribute to improving accessibility in language education.

tensorflow.purpose: Doctoral thesis "Application of LLMs in Foreign Language Education"
tensorflow.description: Working on fine-tuning and building large language models (LLMs). With applications in foreign language education in mind, I implement parameter adjustment and optimization of training processes. I also have experience with production environment deployment using the TensorFlow ecosystem.

pytorch.purpose: Research and development of natural language processing models
pytorch.description: Used for implementation and experimentation with the latest language model architectures. Leveraging the flexibility of dynamic computation graphs to implement custom layers and loss functions. Also conducting training of large-scale models using distributed learning and model optimization using quantization techniques.

transformers.purpose: Research and application of cutting-edge NLP models
transformers.description: Implementation of various NLP tasks using pre-trained language models. Contributing to the development of educational support systems that integrate functions such as text generation, classification, and summarization. Improving the accuracy of automatic generation of educational content through model customization and fine-tuning.

axolotl.description: Utilized for efficient model adjustment under computational resource constraints. Developing education-specialized LLMs while minimizing GPU requirements using techniques such as QLoRA and LoRA. Conducting fine-tuning with original datasets that consider the characteristics of formal language learners.
